title: Biko Botowamungu
text:
Ikomoniya "Biko" Botowamungu (born 22 January 1957) is a former <a href="boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Austria">Austria</a>. Born in <a href="Kisangani">Stanleyville</a>, <a href="Belgian%20Congo">Belgian Congo</a>, he competed at the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201988%20Summer%20Olympics">1988 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Seoul">Seoul</a>, <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a> in the super-heavyweight (+ 91 kg) division where he was defeated by <a href="Riddick%20Bowe">Riddick Bowe</a> of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> in his opening bout. Botowamungu was Austrian amateur champion in heavyweight (1983) and super-heavyweight (1984-1989 and 1992).
Botowamungu had a professional boxing record of 10 wins, 16 losses and a draw.
In his homeland, Botowamungu was a wrestler. He was to compete in the <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">1976 Summer Olympics</a> in that sport, representing <a href="Zaire">Zaire</a> but the African nation did not compete in <a href="Montreal">Montreal</a>, citing economic reasons.
After coming to Austria, for a time he became a professional wrestler known as "Dr. Biko". Later, Botowamungu became a Baptist minister. He also appeared on <a href="Dancing%20Stars%20%28Austria%20season%208%29">Dancing Stars</a>.
